sm::eod::ImageOutputData

ImageOutputData Class Reference

#include <imageoutputdata.h>

Inherits Serializable.

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Data class that represents an image output by the Tracking Engine.

Definition at line 19 of file imageoutputdata.h.

ImageOutputData (  ) 

Constructs andImageOutputDataTestCase empty object.

Postcondition:
imageFormat() == 1

width, height, rawData and bytesPerLine are all 0

imageIdentifier is the empty string

std::string imageIdentifier (  )  const

Returns a string used to identify an image.

Images can be associated with an identifier. This can be used to identify images such as raw image or a data image.

void setImageIdentifier ( const std::string &  image_identifier  )

void setNewImage ( uint32  width,
uint32  height,
uint32  bytes_per_line,
const uint8 *  raw_data,
int32  image_format 
)

Allocates a new block of aligned memory copying the raw data.

Deallocates any previously allocated raw data.

Parameters:
width The width of the image. Must be in the range (0, bytes_per_line].
height The height of the image.
bytes_per_line The number of bytes between 2 lines.
raw_data Pointer to the raw data.
image_format ImageFormat describing the image format.
Postcondition:
rawData() != 0

rawData() % RAW_DATA_BYTE_ALIGNMENT == 0

void shareNewImage ( uint32  width,
uint32  height,
uint32  bytes_per_line,
uint8 *  raw_data,
int32  image_format 
)

Uses an existing block of memory for image data.

Deallocates any previously allocated raw data. The existing block of memory must outlive the lifetime of this object or until setNewImage() is called.

Parameters:
width The width of the image. Must be in the range (0, bytes_per_line].
height The height of the image.
bytes_per_line The number of bytes between 2 lines.
raw_data Pointer to the raw data which must be aligned on a RAW_DATA_BYTE_ALIGNMENT byte boundary.
image_format ImageFormat describing the image format.

uint32 width (  )  const

Returns the width of the image in pixels.
